issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Snapshot deltas should log important activity at INFO level to help with troubleshooting any issues.

Some current DEBUG level logging could be changed to INFO and we should ensure logging sufficient / consistent.
fields.summary: Snapshot deltas should log important activity at INFO level

comments.body:
Bumping up all the debug logging to info causes too much info logging. 

We should log at info when actions are performed, e.g. a snapshot delta is created or deleted on s3, but we should not log at info every time we check if we need to take some action for a snapshot. There could be 1000s of snapshots and logging at info for every snapshot every minute is excessive.
[~sjones], I agree with you in principal. I think I've tried to follow the same model. Do you have a list of message that you think should be moved back to debug level?

Here is the current INFO log output for a 5 minute period when there is one snapshot present and max deltas is 10:

{code}

I am moving this message back to debug as well. I thought it is valuable to know why a snapshot is not deleted from OSG but logging so many messages is an overkill.

Verified.  Logging is working as expected.
